page.title: 08F.OF D. DEAN HALL SCHOOL
page.content:
{ { DEAN HALL WAS BUILT IN 1915 AS A SCHOOL OF FORESTRY & BECAME A SCHOOL IN 1958 FOR PUPILS FROM THE SEVERN BRIDGE TO NEWENT WHO HAVE LEARNING DIFFICULTIES. THERE ARE 110 PUPILS AGED 5-16 WITH 12-15 IN A CLASS.
THE CHILDREN DO NOT WEAR UNIFORM. THEY START SCHOOL AT 9.15 A.M. & FINISH AT 3.15 P.M. BUSES BRING THE CHILDREN TO SCHOOL.
THE CHILDREN LEARN READING, WRITING & MATHS THROUGH PRACTICAL ACTIVITIES SUCH AS BUILDING A BOAT & A KITCHEN. THEY RIDE HORSES, SWIM, DO WOODWORK & POTTERY AND RIDE MOPEDS.
THE CHILDREN ENJOY THEIR GAMES: FOOTBALL, ROUNDERS .. {CONT.PAGE 9..}
